question.text: Read the following statements and find out the INCORRECT statement.

options.text: In an animal cell, cytokinesis is achieved by the appearance of a furrow in the plasma membrane.
Furrow formation starts in the centre of cell and grows outward to meet the existing lateral walls.
Cell plate represents the middle lamella between the walls of two adjacent plant cells.
During cytokinesis, organelles like mitochondria and plastids get distributed between the two daughter cells.

solution.text: Cytokinesis is the final step in cell division. Cleavage furrow forms at the equatorial cortex after anaphase. This furrow advances inwards to separate the two daughter cells. Furrow formation is done by actin-myosin filaments within the equatorial region to form cleavage during early anaphase.  Various organelles are distributed between the newly formed two daughter cells.
